casebody.data:
Aaron LUCY, Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. No. ED 105139 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. Filed: February 13, 2018 Susan DeGeorge, 1010 Market Street, Suite 1100, St. Louis, MO 63101, for appellant Karen L. Kramer, Assistant Attorney General, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102, for respondent Before Lisa P. Page, P.J., Roy L. Richter, J., and Philip M. Hess, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Aaron Lucy appeals the denial of his Rule 29.15 motion for post-conviction relief. Lucy was convicted of murder in the first-degree, abuse of a child resulting in death, two counts of armed criminal action, and tampering with physical evidence. We affirm.

The judgment of the trial court is not clearly erroneous. An extended opinion would have no precedential value. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
